page.title: 04Farm animals, Belsay
page.content: This area was formerly well known as a stock feeding region but this changed when farmers were required to produce cereals during the 1939/45 period and more latterly since the U.K. joined the Common Market and now only about 50% of the land is used for grass feeding of cattle and sheep. There has been a significant increase in the area of covered cattle yards for inside winter feeding of cattle, these are fed on silage, barley and barley straw. There are no milk producing farms in this block. Sheep are also kept undercover in the winter until after they have lambed and older lambs are brought in for fattening. Average prices Sept 1985:_ Beef 93p per Kg live weight, Lambs 157p per Kg est. dead weight.
